title: Vitamins, Supplements and Autism: The Important Link
author: Judah Schiller
description: Research has shown that there is a link between certain vitamins and the severity of autism symptoms.

They play a crucial role in maintaining our overall health and well-being. However, did you know that certain vitamins have been shown to have a significant impact on individuals with autism? Research has shown that there is a link between certain vitamins and the severity of autism symptoms. One of the most important vitamins for individuals with autism is Vitamin D. This essential vitamin is produced in our skin when it is exposed to sunlight. It is also found in certain foods such as fatty fish, egg yolks, and fortified milk. Studies have found that individuals with autism are often deficient in Vitamin D, which can lead to a variety of health problems, including weakened bones, muscle weakness, and an increased risk of infections. In addition to Vitamin D, B Vitamins have also been found to be important for individuals with autism. B Vitamins, such as B6 and B12, play a crucial role in brain function and development. Research has shown that people with autism often have [low levels of B Vitamins](https://www.autismparentingmagazine.com/best-supplements-vitamins-autism/), which can lead to behavioral and cognitive problems. Another important vitamin for individuals with autism is Vitamin C. Vitamin C is a powerful antioxidant that helps to protect the body from damage caused by free radicals. Research has shown that individuals with autism often have higher levels of oxidative stress, which can lead to a variety of health problems, including inflammation and damage to the brain. Vitamin C has been shown to reduce oxidative stress and improve overall health in individuals with autism.
